tud.iir.extraction
Class PageAnalyzer

java.lang.Object
  tud.iir.extraction.PageAnalyzer

public class PageAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object

The PageAnalyzer's responsibility is it to perform generic tasks on the DOM tree.

The xpath string pointing to the node.<DD><CODE>lookBack</CODE> - How many parent nodes should be taken into account, e.g. with a lookBack of 3 the xpath /div/table/tr/td/div/span/a/b is not considered in a table because there is too much structure in the cell (more than 3 parents of the last node are not table structures). <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>True if given xpath points to a node in a table, else false.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getTableCellPath(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getTableCellPath</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getTableCellPath</B>(java.lang.String xPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Get the xPath to the table cell where the given xPath is pointing to. e.g. /div/p/table/tr/td/a[5]/b => /div/p/table/tr/td <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xPath</CODE> - The xPath. <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>The string representation of an xPath.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getTargetNode(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getTargetNode</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getTargetNode</B>(java.lang.String xpath)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Get the name of the node the given xPath is pointing to. e.g. /html/body/div/table[5]/tr/td[3]/p/a[4] => a <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xpath</CODE> - A box is the "p" and the "div" tag. <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xPath</CODE> - The xPath.<DD><CODE>lookBack</CODE> - How many parent nodes should be considered. <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>True if the specified xPath is in a box, else false.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="findLastBoxSection(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> findLastBoxSection</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>findLastBoxSection</B>(java.lang.String xPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Find the last box section ("p", "div", "td" or "th") of the given xPath. This is helpful as a certain term might be in a too deep structure and searched elements are around it. e.g. /table/tr/td/div[4]/span/b/a => /table/tr/td/div[4] <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xPath</CODE> - The xPath. <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>The potentially shortened xPath if found, else the input xPath.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getNextSibling(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getNextSibling</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getNextSibling</B>(java.lang.String xPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD><DL> </DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getNextSibling(java.lang.String, boolean)"><!-- --></A><H3> getNextSibling</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getNextSibling</B>(java.lang.String xPath, boolean tableCellSibling)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Create an xpath that points to the next sibling of the node specified by the given xPath. e.g. /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1] => /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[2] /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1]/div[4] => /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1]/div[5] /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/th/b/a => /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1]/b/a /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td => /div/p/table[4]/tr[7]/td ----- with tableCellSibling = true ----- /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1]/div[4] => /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[2]/div[4] (compare with above) /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/th/div[4] => /div/p/table[4]/tr[6]/td[1]/div[4] TODO sometimes a spacer cell is between attribute and value: http://www.smartone-vodafone.com/jsp/phone/english/detail_v3.jsp?id=662 <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xPath</CODE> - The xPath<DD><CODE>tableCellSibling</CODE> - If true, only siblings of table cells (td,th) are searched. <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>The xpath pointing to the sibling.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getNextTableCell(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getNextTableCell</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getNextTableCell</B>(java.lang.String xPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD><DL> </DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getFirstTableCell(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getFirstTableCell</H3> <PRE> public java.lang.String <B>getFirstTableCell</B>(java.lang.String xPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Point xPath to first table cell. For example: //TABLE/TR/TD => //TABLE/TR/TD[1] //TABLE/TR/TD[1] => //TABLE/TR/TD[1] //TABLE/TR/TH => //TABLE/TR/TH <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>xPath</CODE> - The xPath. <DT><B>Returns:</B><DD>The xPath pointing to the first table cell of the deepest table.</DL> </DD> </DL> <HR> <A NAME="getNumberOfTableRows(java.lang.String)"><!-- --></A><H3> getNumberOfTableRows</H3> <PRE> public int <B>getNumberOfTableRows</B>(java.lang.String attributeXPath)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Get number of table rows. <P> <DD><DL> <DT><B>Parameters:</B><DD><CODE>attributeXPath</CODE> -
